In this session we will be discussing from the 49th verse of the 9th chapter
of the 1st chapter of the 9th chapter of the 9th chapter of the 9th chapter of the
canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This is the last verse of this chapter.
Pitrachanumato Raja Vasudevanumoditaha Chakararajyam Dharmena Pitrpaitamaham Vibhuhu.
The meaning of this verse is, after this, the great religious king Maharaj Yudhishthira
executed the royal power in the kingdom strictly according to the codes and royal principles
approved by his uncle and confirmed by Lord Sri Krishna.
So, this is the ending of this chapter. What did Yudhishthira do after Bhishma Deva passed away?
He performed a funeral ceremony and the sages glorified Krishna and went back to their
respective hermitages. Then Krishna and Yudhishthira immediately returned to the palace of
Hastinapura to pacify Dhritarashtra and Gandhari. And after that, Yudhishthira assumed
responsibility of ruling the entire world exactly in accordance with the codes and principles
given in the shastras approved by Dhritarashtra, his uncle and by Lord Sri Krishna, the Supreme Lord.
So, Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport,
Maharaj Yudhishthira was not a mere tax collector. He was always conscious of his duty as a king,
which is no less than that of a father or spiritual master.
King means he is a very responsible person in the society.
He has got responsibility towards the citizens who are under his care. Citizens are under his care.
So, Prabhupada explains the Vedic conception of what is the duty of a king.
The king is to see the welfare of the citizens from all angles of socio,
political, economic, and spiritual upliftment.
This is the great responsibility of the king in the Vedic culture as given in the scriptures.

Superior to modern republics or governments of the people by the people. Nowadays people
are very proud that we have got what is called as democracy. But in democracy, the defect
is that the mass of people who elect their leaders or their rulers, they are especially
in the Jivkali, they are basically low born, they are ill trained, they are unfortunate
and badly associated. This is described in the Bhagavatam. In Kali Yuga people are disqualified

therefore votes cast by them actually have no value. And persons elected by such illiterate
people, irresponsible votes cannot be people elected by such irresponsible votes cannot

an elected government by the people who do not have the qualification to select a proper
